SENT.plain: A 42-year-old male patient with a history of occupational exposure to benzene presented with pancytopenia
His bone marrow showed evidence of trilineage dysplasia and cytogenetic analysis revealed a unique t(9;13)(q34;q12) translocation
Five months after diagnosis he developed secondary AML
He was treated with four courses of chemotherapy and an autologous bone marrow transplantation (BMT)
Four years post-transplantation he remains in haematological and morphological remission though the cytogenetic abnormality is still present in all metaphases examined
